docs.title: tab
docs.text: A CLI tool for viewing, querying, and converting tabular data files. Supports AWS / Azure / Google Cloud Storage URLs.

docs.title: View data
docs.text:
Display rows from a tabular data file:

tab view data.csv

Output to different formats:

tab view data.parquet -o jsonl
tab view data.parquet -o csv

docs.title: SQL queries
docs.text:
Run SQL queries on your data. The table is referenced as t:

tab sql 'SELECT * FROM t WHERE Metric_A_Value > 80' test.csv

docs.title: Convert
docs.text:
Convert between formats:

tab convert data.csv data.parquet
tab convert data.parquet data.jsonl -o jsonl

Write partitioned output:

tab convert data.csv output_dir/ -o parquet -n 4

docs.title: Concatenate multiple files
docs.text: tab cat data1.csv data2.csv data3.csv -o jsonl > output.jsonl

docs.title: Common options
docs.text: Option Description -i Input format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl). Auto-detected from extension. -o Output format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl). --limit Maximum number of rows to display. --skip Number of rows to skip from the beginning.

docs.title: Convert options
docs.text: Option Description -n Number of output partitions. Creates a directory with part files.

docs.title: Interpretation of az:// URLs
docs.text:
The az:// URL scheme is used to access Azure Blob Storage. The interpretation of the URL authority (the part between az:// and the first /) can be configured with the --az-url-authority-is-account flag.

Two interpretations are supported:

  • az://$account/$container/$path - the authority is the storage account name
  • az://$container/$path - the authority is the container name (default adlfs behavior)

The first form requires the --az-url-authority-is-account flag. The second form is consistent with s3:// and gs:// URLs, but requires the AZURE_STORAGE_ACCOUNT environment variable to be set.

docs.title: tab view
docs.text:
View tabular data from a data file, or a directory of partitions of data files.

tab view $path [OPTIONS]

Options:

Option Description -i / --input-format Input format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl, avro). Auto-detected from extension if omitted. -o / --output-format Output format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl, avro). If not specified, print Rich table in terminal. --limit Maximum number of rows to display. --skip Number of rows to skip from the beginning.

docs.title: tab schema
docs.text:
Display the schema of a tabular data file.

tab schema $path [OPTIONS]

Options:

Option Description -i / --input-format Input format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl, avro). Auto-detected from extension if omitted.

docs.title: tab summary
docs.text:
Display summary information about a tabular data file.

tab summary $path [OPTIONS]

Options:

Option Description -i / --input-format Input format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl, avro). Auto-detected from extension if omitted.

docs.title: tab sql
docs.text:
Run a SQL query on tabular data. The table is available as t.

tab sql $query $path [OPTIONS]

Options:

Option Description -i / --input-format Input format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl, avro). Auto-detected from extension if omitted. -o / --output-format Output format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl, avro). If not specified, print Rich table in terminal. --limit Maximum number of rows to display. --skip Number of rows to skip from the beginning.

docs.title: tab convert
docs.text:
Convert tabular data from one format to another.

tab convert $src $dst [OPTIONS]

Options:

Option Description -i / --input-format Input format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl, avro). Auto-detected from extension if omitted. -o / --output-format Output format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl, avro). If not specified, inherits from input format. -n / --num-partitions Number of output partitions. Creates a directory with partition files.

docs.title: tab cat
docs.text:
Concatenate tabular data from multiple files.

tab cat $paths [OPTIONS]

Options:

Option Description -i / --input-format Input format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl, avro). Auto-detected from extension if omitted. -o / --output-format Output format (parquet, csv, tsv, jsonl, avro). If not specified, print Rich table in terminal.

docs.title: Global options
docs.text: Option Description --az-url-authority-is-account Interpret az:// URL authority as storage account name instead of container name. See azure.md for more information.
